election_record.label: New York 1817 Lieutenant Governor, Special

candidate.name: John Tayler
candidate.note: Listed as John Tayler of Sand Lake.

overview.note: Some sources list John Conkite as John Cronhile or John Coonkite.
The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists Joseph Winsor as Joseph Wisner and John Yale as John Bailker.
John Tayler ran for Lieutenant Governor with no organized opposition, resulting in the large number of scattering votes in this election.

"The Election, in this State, opens to-day, and under circumstances never before witnessed since the people divided into two great political parties. There is but one candidate for the first office, and in most of the counties, the strife for members of the Legislature is confined to the present ruling party. It is not probable that many of the federalists will go to the polls, except in counties and districts where federal candidates are nominated. --This course is believed to be dictated by sound policy--It is not, as Mr. Coleman would infer, that 'federalism is abadndoned in the Western District'--but that opposition, after what we have experienced, is considered worse than useless--serving only to draw out and consolidate the whole force of democracy, which otherwise would, from its inconsistency, divide and fall to pieces." Ontario Repository (Canandaigua, NY). April 29, 1817.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: John Taylor received 1 vote as John Taye.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: The Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) lists 30 votes for John W. Anderson.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: The New York Columbian lists 1668 votes for John Tayler.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: The Independent American (Ballston Spa, NY) of May 14, 1817 did not include vote totals for the towns of Galway and Northumberland. Based on the total vote for the two towns (159), and an estimation based on the votes for State Senate in the same two towns, John Tayler likely received 95 votes in Galway and 64 in Northumberland.
Several sources list 1403 votes for John Tayler though the town totals add up to 1413.

sub_unit.name: Coeymans
sub_unit.note: "No returns have yet been received at the Clerk's office from the town of Coeymans." The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY). May 7, 1817.

sub_unit.name: Chenango
sub_unit.note: The Official Canvass of Votes lists 1004 votes for John Tayler though the town votes add up to 992 votes.

sub_unit.name: Delaware
sub_unit.note: No returns were reported from Colchester and Hancock.

sub_unit.name: Middletown
sub_unit.note: Joseph Dimmick received 1 vote as Josephet Dimmick.

sub_unit.name: Ulster
sub_unit.note: The New York Columbian lists 538 votes for John Tayler.

sub_unit.name: Plattekill
sub_unit.note: The Ulster Plebeian lists 29 votes for John Tayler.

sub_unit.name: New York
sub_unit.note: John Taylor received 1 vote as John Taye.

sub_unit.name: Suffolk
sub_unit.note: John Taylor received 1 vote as Jonathan Taylor.

sub_unit.name: Westchester
sub_unit.note: The New York Columbian lists 558 votets for John Tayler.

sub_unit.name: Cayuga
sub_unit.note: The Official Canvass of Votes lists 1970 votes for John Tayler though the town totals add up to 2005.

sub_unit.name: Aurelius
sub_unit.note: The Auburn Gazette (Auburn, NY) lists 343 votes for John Tayler.

sub_unit.name: Ontario
sub_unit.note: John Tayler received 1 vote as John Tayer.
The New York Columbian lists 2359 votes for John Tayler.

sub_unit.name: Fayette
sub_unit.note: John Taylor received 6 votes as John Talor.

sub_unit.name: Tompkins
sub_unit.note: Landmarks of Tompkins County New York and History of Tioga, Chemung, Tompkins, and Schuyler Counties list 1278 votes for John Tayler, though the town totals add up to 1288.
